page.title: 05A Hexton Farmer's Day
page.content: { I live at Barton Hill Farm}and my daddy is a farmer. This is a typical day of his life in June. From{0615}he attends to the chickens and dogs and {goes to work.}He meets the seven farm workers to discuss the day's schedule, and gets the machines filled with sprays or water. At{0800}there is a {breakfast break.}Afterwards he goes {crop spraying.}When he has finished he has lunch, collects eggs and feeds the pets. After lunch he cleans dirty machinery and supervises repair jobs. He checks the crops for diseases and predators. At{1700 he has tea with the {family.}After this he orders fertiliser for autumn, makes telephone calls, does garden jobs and some office work. At{2245}he puts the chickens and dogs away and{goes to {bed, at last!
